verses.verse: My son, <WH1121> pay attention <WH7181> to my wisdom. <WH2451> Turn <WH5186> your ear <WH241> to my understanding: <WH8394>
that you may maintain <WH8104> discretion, <WH4209> that your lips <WH8193> may preserve <WH5341> knowledge. <WH1847>
For the lips <WH8193> of an adulteress <WH2114> drip <WH5197> honey. <WH5317> Her mouth <WH2441> is smoother <WH2509> than oil, <WH8081>
But in the end <WH319> she is as bitter <WH4751> as wormwood, <WH3939> and as sharp <WH2299> as a two-edged <WH6310> sword. <WH2719>
Her feet <WH7272> go down <WH3381> to death. <WH4194> Her steps <WH6806> lead straight <WH8551> to Sheol. <WH7585>
She gives no thought <WH6424> to the way <WH4570> of life. <WH2416> Her ways <WH4570> are crooked, <WH5128> and she doesn't <WH3045> know it.
Now therefore, <WH1121> my sons, listen <WH8085> to me. <WH5493> Don't depart from the words <WH561> of my mouth. <WH6310>
Remove <WH7368> your way <WH1870> far <WH7368> from her. <WH7126> Don't come near the door <WH6607> of her house, <WH1004>
lest you give <WH5414> your honor <WH1935> to others, <WH312> and your years <WH8141> to the cruel one; <WH394>
lest strangers <WH2114> feast <WH7646> on your wealth, <WH3581> and your labors <WH6089> enrich another man <WH5237>'s house. <WH1004>
You will groan <WH5098> at your latter <WH319> end, <WH1320> when your flesh and your body <WH1320> are consumed, <WH3615>
and say, <WH559> "How I have hated <WH8130> instruction, <WH4148> and my heart <WH3820> despised <WH5006> reproof; <WH8433>
neither have I obeyed <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of my teachers, <WH3384> nor turned <WH5186> my ear <WH241> to those who instructed me! <WH3925>
I have come to the brink <WH4592> of utter ruin, <WH7451> in the midst <WH8432> of the gathered <WH6951> assembly. <WH6951>"
Drink <WH8354> water <WH4325> out of your own cistern, <WH953> running water <WH5140> out of <WH8432> your own well. <WH875>
Should your springs <WH4599> overflow <WH6327> in the streets, <WH7339> streams <WH6388> of water <WH4325> in the public squares? <WH7339>
Let them be for yourself alone, <WH2114> not for strangers with you.
Let your spring <WH4726> be blessed. <WH1288> Rejoice <WH8055> in the wife <WH802> of your youth. <WH5271>

A loving <WH158> doe <WH365> and a graceful <WH2580> deer <WH3280>â€” let her breasts <WH1717> satisfy <WH7301> you at all times. <WH6256> Be captivated <WH7686> always <WH8548> with her love. <WH160>
For why should you, <WH1121> my son, be captivated <WH7686> with an adulteress? <WH2114> Why embrace <WH2263> the bosom <WH2436> of another? <WH5237>
For the ways <WH1870> of man <WH376> are before <WH5227> the eyes <WH5869> of Yahweh. <WH3068> He examines <WH6424> all his paths. <WH4570>
The evil <WH5771> deeds of the wicked <WH7563> ensnare <WH3920> him. <WH2256> The cords of his sin <WH2403> hold him firmly. <WH8551>
He will die <WH4191> for lack of instruction. <WH4148> In the greatness <WH7230> of his folly, <WH200> he will go astray. <WH7686>
